The position of double bond in alkenes can be located by :;(a) Hydrogenation of oil;(b) Ozonolysis;(c) Photolysis;(d) Hydration;"(b) Ozonolysis
Explanation:

Ozonolysis is the cleavage of an alkene or alkyne with ozone to form organic compounds in which the multiple carbon-carbon bonds have been replaced by a double bond to oxygen. The outcome of the reaction depends on the type of multiple bonds being oxidized."

Explanation:
The correct order of deactivation is
−NO2 > −C ≡ N > −SO32 H > −COOH"

column1: The order of decreasing reactivity towards an electrophilic reagent, for the following : (i) Benzene (ii) Toluene (iii) Chlorobenzene (iv) Phenol would be:;(a) (i) > (ii) > (iii) > (iv);(b) (ii) > (iv) > (i) > (iii);(c) (iv) > (iii) > (ii) > (i);(d) (iv) > (ii) > (i) > (iii);(d) (iv) > (ii) > (i) > (iii)
Explanation:
Benzene having any activating group i.e.
column4: undergoes electrophilic substitution very easily as compared to benzene itself. Thus toluene (C6H5CH3)
column5: phenol (C6H5OH) undergo electrophilic substitution very readily than benzene. Chlorine with +E and +M effect deactivates the ring due to strong -I effect. So
column6: it is difficult to carry out the substitution in chlorobenzene than in benzene
column7: so correct order is Phenol (iv) > Toluene (ii) > Benzene (i) > Chlorobenzene (iii)"

column1: Pure methane can be prepared by;(a) Soda lime decarboxylation;(b) Kolbes electrolytic method;(c) Wurtz reaction;(d) Reduction with H2;"(a) Soda lime decarboxylation

Methane cannot be prepared by either Wurtz reaction
column2: Kolbes electrolytic method or by reduction of alkenes with H2. While acetic acid salt on heating with soda lime gives methane.

During fractionation or distillation of petroleum

column1: 2 – Phenylpropene on acidic hydration gives;(a) 2 – Phenyl – 2 – propanol;(b) 2 – Phenyl – 1 – propanol;(c) 3 – Phenyl – 1 – propanol;(d) 1 – Phenyl – 2 – propanol;"(a) 2 – Phenyl – 2 – propanol
Explanation:

The coal tar fraction which contains phenol is:;(a) Heavy Oil;(b) Light Oil;(c) Middle Oil;(d) Green Oil;(c) Middle Oil
Explanation:
The second fraction of coal-tar distillation which distills at 170°−230°C is called middle-oil or olic oil. It contains mainly phenol

Which one of these is not true for benzene?;(a) There are three carbon-carbon single bonds and three carbon-carbon double bonds.;(b) Heat of hydrogenation of benzene is less than the theoretical value;(c) It forms only one type of mono substituted product;(d) The bond angle between carbon-carbon bonds is 120 Degree;"(a) There are three carbon-carbon single bonds and three carbon-carbon double bonds.
Explanation:
There are three carbon-carbon single bonds and three carbon-carbon double bonds."
The catalyst used in Friedel – Crafts reaction is;(a) Aluminium Chloride;(b) Anhydrous Aluminium Chloride;(c) Ferric Chloride;(d) Copper .;"(b) Anhydrous Aluminium Chloride
Explanation:
It is a catalyst-based electrophilic substitution reaction. Lewis acids like anhydrous AlCl3
column3: BF3 and BiCl3 can be used as catalysts. The catalyst facilitates more effective attack by the electrophile (R+
column4: RCO+ etc.) on the benzene ring."

column1: Alkyl halides react with dialkyl copper reagents to give?;(a) Alkanes;(b) Alkenes;(c) Hydrogen;(d) Carbon;"(a) Alkanes
Explanation:
Alkyl halides react with dialkyl copper reagents to give Alkanes."

Presence of a nitro group in a benzene ring;(a) Activates the ring towards electrophilic substitution;(b) Renders the ring basic;(c) Deactivates the ring towards nucleophilic substitution;(d) Deactivates the ring towards electrophilic substitution;"(d) Deactivates the ring towards electrophilic substitution
Explanation:
−NO2 group shows −M effect
column2: so withdraws the electron density from the ring and hence deactivate the ring towards electrophilic aromatic substitution."
